title: Mathematics Learning Design Using IMS-LD and Development of UML-Based Activity Diagrams

context.prior_knowledge: Basic instructional design concepts and understanding of mathematics curriculum content
context.additional_context: For pre-service and in-service secondary mathematics teachers, acquiring systematic instructional design methods using IMS-LD and UML.

learning_goals: They can explain core elements of IMS-LD (learning activities, resources, roles, conditions) and apply them to each stage of mathematics curriculum design.
They can visually design the activity flow of mathematics learning processes using UML activity diagrams.
Through project-based assessment, learners can complete mathematics learning design documents incorporating peer feedback and iterative improvements.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
